actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide an additional investment tax credit for fire prevention equipment.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to qualify fire prevention property for the investment tax credit. Defines "fire prevention property" as depreciable property with a useful life of three years or more which is: (1) an automatic sprinkler system; (2) an early fire detection system; (3) a fire extinguisher; (4) a fire-rated door or wall; or (5) an item which, pursuant to regulations, the Secretary of the Treasury specifies as increasing a building's fire safety.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide an additional investment tax credit for fire prevention equipment.
